document.heading: District of Columbia Revenue Act of 1971

history.narrative: Law 1-30, the “District of Columbia Revenue Act of 1971,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 1-156, which was referred to the Committee on Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on July 15, 1975 and July 29, 1975, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on August 13, 1975, it was assigned Act No. 1-42 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
